auction."},"NewSale(uint256,address,address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a buyer buys from a direct listing, or a lister accepts some      buyer's offer to their direct listing."},"PlatformFeeInfoUpdated(address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when fee on primary sales is updated."},"PlatformFeeTypeUpdated(uint8)":{"details":"Emitted when the platform fee type is updated."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._"},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"acceptOffer(uint256,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Lets a listing's creator accept an offer for their direct listing."},"buy(uint256,address,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Lets an account buy a given quantity of tokens from a listing."},"cancelDirectListing(uint256)":{"details":"Lets a direct listing creator cancel their listing."},"closeAuction(uint256,address)":{"details":"Lets an account close an auction for either the (1) winning bidder, or (2) auction creator."},"contractType()":{"details":"Returns the type of the contract."},"contractVersion()":{"details":"Returns the version of the contract."},"createListing((address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint8))":{"details":"Lets a token owner list tokens for sale: Direct Listing or Auction."},"getPlatformFeeInfo()":{"details":"Returns the platform fee recipient and bps."},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,string,address[],address,uint256)":{"details":"Initializes the contract, like a constructor."},"multicall(bytes[])":{"details":"Receives and executes a batch of function calls on this contract.","params":{"data":"The bytes data that makes up the batch of function calls to execute."},"returns":{"results":"The bytes data that makes up the result of the batch of function calls executed."}},"offer(uint256,uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Lets an account (1) make an offer to a direct listing, or (2) make a bid in an auction."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setAuctionBuffers(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Lets a contract admin set auction buffers."},"setContractURI(string)":{"details":"Lets a contract admin set the URI for the contract-level metadata."},"setPlatformFeeInfo(address,uint256)":{"details":"Lets a contract admin update platform fee recipient and bps."},"updateListing(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Lets a listing's creator edit the listing's parameters."}},"stateVariables":{"ASSET_ROLE":{"details":"Only assets from NFT contracts with asset role can be listed, when listings are restricted by asset address."},"LISTER_ROLE":{"details":"Only lister role holders can create listings, when listings are restricted by lister address."},"MAX_BPS":{"details":"The max bps of the contract. So, 10_000 == 100 %"},"bidBufferBps":{"details":"The minimum % increase required from the previous winning bid. Default: 5%."},"contractURI":{"details":"Contract level metadata."},"listings":{"details":"Mapping from uid of listing => listing info."},"nativeTokenWrapper":{"details":"The address of the native token wrapper contract."},"offers":{"details":"Mapping from uid of a direct listing => offeror address => offer made to the direct listing by the respective offeror."},"platformFeeBps":{"details":"The % of primary sales collected as platform fees."},"platformFeeRecipient":{"details":"The address that receives all platform fees from all sales."},"timeBuffer":{"details":"The amount of time added to an auction's 'endTime', if a bid is made within `timeBuffer`       seconds of the existing `endTime`. Default: 15 minutes."},"totalListings":{"details":"Total number of listings ever created in the marketplace."},"winningBid":{"details":"Mapping from uid of an auction listing => current winning bid in acceptOffer(uint256,address,address,uint.details: Lets a listing's creator accept an offer for their direct listing.

buy(uint256,address,uint256,address,uint.details: Lets an account buy a given quantity of tokens from a listing.

cancelDirectListing(uint256).details: Lets a direct listing creator cancel their listing.

closeAuction(uint256,address).details: Lets an account close an auction for either the (1) winning bidder, or (2) auction creator.

contractType().details: Returns the type of the contract.

contractVersion().details: Returns the version of the contract.

createListing((address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Lets a token owner list tokens for sale: Direct Listing or Auction.

getPlatformFeeInfo().details: Returns the platform fee recipient and bps.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize(address,string,address[],addr.details: Initializes the contract, like a constructor.

multicall(bytes[]).details: Receives and executes a batch of function calls on this contract.

params.data: The bytes data that makes up the batch of function calls to execute.

returns.results: The bytes data that makes up the result of the batch of function calls executed.

offer(uint256,uint256,address,uint256,ui.details: Lets an account (1) make an offer to a direct listing, or (2) make a bid in an auction.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setAuctionBuffers(uint256,uint256).details: Lets a contract admin set auction buffers.

setContractURI(string).details: Lets a contract admin set the URI for the contract-level metadata.

setPlatformFeeInfo(address,uint256).details: Lets a contract admin update platform fee recipient and bps.

updateListing(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Lets a listing's creator edit the listing's parameters.

multicall(bytes[]).notice: Receives and executes a batch of function calls on this contract.

documentation.text: @dev Only lister role holders can create listings, when listings are restricted by lister address.
@dev Only assets from NFT contracts with asset role can be listed, when listings are restricted by asset address.
@dev The address of the native token wrapper contract.
@dev Total number of listings ever created in the marketplace.
@dev Contract level metadata.
@dev The address that receives all platform fees from all sales.
@dev The max bps of the contract. So, 10_000 == 100 %
@dev The % of primary sales collected as platform fees.

@dev The amount of time added to an auction's 'endTime', if a bid is made within `timeBuffer`
       seconds of the existing `endTime`. Default: 15 minutes.
@dev The minimum % increase required from the previous winning bid. Default: 5%.
@dev Mapping from uid of listing => listing info.
@dev Mapping from uid of a direct listing => offeror address => offer made to the direct listing by the respective offeror.
@dev Mapping from uid of an auction listing => current winning bid in an auction.
@dev Checks whether caller is a listing creator.
@dev Checks whether a listing exists.
@dev Initializes the contract, like a constructor.
@dev Lets the contract receives native tokens from `nativeTokenWrapper` withdraw.
@dev Returns the type of the contract.
@dev Returns the version of the contract.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,address,uint256[] memory,uint256[] memory,bytes memory) external returns (bytes4)

documentation.text: @dev Lets a token owner list tokens for sale: Direct Listing or Auction.
@dev Lets a listing's creator edit the listing's parameters.
@dev Lets a direct listing creator cancel their listing.
@dev Lets an account buy a given quantity of tokens from a listing.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarketplace.Offer storage ref))
mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarketplace.Offer storage ref))

documentation.text: @dev Lets a listing's creator accept an offer for their direct listing.
@dev Performs a direct listing sale.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "must use approved currency to bid"

arguments.value: must use approved currency to bid

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "must use approved currency to bid"

documentation.text: @dev Lets an account (1) make an offer to a direct listing, or (2) make a bid in an auction.

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => struct IMarketplace.Offer storage ref))

documentation.text: @dev Processes a new offer to a direct listing.

statements.documentation:
If there's an existng winning bid, incoming bid amount must be bid buffer % greater.
      Else, bid amount must be at least as great as reserve price

documentation.text: @dev Processes an incoming bid in an auction.
@dev Checks whether an incoming bid is the new current highest bid.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "cannot close auction before it has ended."

arguments.value: cannot close auction before it has ended.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "cannot close auction before it has ended."

documentation.text: @dev Lets an account close an auction for either the (1) winning bidder, or (2) auction creator.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "caller is not the listing creator."

arguments.value: caller is not the listing creator.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "caller is not the listing creator."

documentation.text: @dev Cancels an auction.
@dev Closes an auction for an auction creator; distributes winning bid amount to auction creator.
@dev Closes an auction for the winning bidder; distributes auction items to the winning bidder.
@dev Transfers tokens listed for sale in a direct or auction listing.
@dev Pays out stakeholders in a sale.
@dev Validates that `_addrToCheck` owns and has approved markeplace to transfer the appropriate amount of currency
@dev Validates that `_tokenOwner` owns and has approved Market to transfer NFTs.
